subhead: As with all letters of intent, the one signed by Emmanuel Macron and Volodymyr Zelensky on Monday was not a formal contract, but simply an official acknowledgment of ongoing negotiations.

Chile's presidential race heads to runoff between communist and hard-right candidates
subhead: Jeannette Jara, 51, a communist and former labor minister representing Chile's center-left governing coalition, won 26.85% of votes with 99% counted – insufficient to win in the first round. Hard-right ex-lawmaker and devout Catholic Jose Antonio Kast, 59, secured more than 23.93%. A second round will take place on December 14.

title: London's 'mudlarks' scour the Thames for treasure
subhead: On the banks of the British capital's river, London's 'mudlarks' search for fragments of the past: ancient pottery, old coins, bone dice. These enthusiasts are less motivated by the value of the objects than by the stories they tell. Sometimes, their finds even end up in a museum, as is currently being shown in an exhibition at the London Museum.

title: Philippe Taquet, dinosaur hunter and former director of French National Museum of Natural History, has died
subhead: Originally destined to take over his family's textile business, this free spirit chose instead the life of a bone hunter, discovering several extinct animal species while building a leading career in public scientific institutions. He died on Sunday at the age of 85.

title: Cryptocurrencies, a fast lane for money laundering
subhead: An international journalistic investigation of which Le Monde is a partner highlights the glaring weaknesses in cryptocurrency exchange platforms, used by criminals to launder money.
byline: Abdelhak El Idrissi and  Spencer Woodman

Euroclear, the Belgian institution managing frozen Russian assets that will 'not rule out' suing the EU
subhead: Euroclear, a little-known but central player in Europe's financial system, holds €193 billion in frozen Russian assets that, since the invasion of Ukraine, have drawn intense scrutiny. Its director general, Valérie Urbain, warns that confiscation – illegal under international law – would weaken Europe's position.

title: 'We hunt for bodies': Ukraine funeral home 'mafia' thrives on war
subhead: Ukraine's funeral services are not immune to corruption. A scandal that has predated the war but been largely kept quiet has accelerated over the past three years. Bereaved families are the primary victims.

title: Jean-Louis Périès, presiding judge in November 13 attacks trial: 'It's impossible to move on, it stays with you for life'
subhead: Four years after presiding over this extraordinary trial, Judge Jean-Louis Périès recalled in an interview with Le Monde an 'almost miraculous' trial, where everyone 'played along, even the defendants.'
